Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to prove that Sen. Specter's party switch will definitely lead to Republicans being able to filibuster judicial nominees at the Judiciary Committee level.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Sen. Specter's party switch will directly result in Republicans gaining the ability to filibuster judicial nominees at the Judiciary Committee level, without considering other factors or circumstances.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or potential counterarguments to the idea that Sen. Specter's party switch will give Republicans the ability to filibuster judicial nominees at the Judiciary Committee level.
